column1: Fremont is a city in Dodge County in the eastern portion of the state of Nebraska in the Midwestern United States.  The population was 26
column2: 397 at the 2010 census.  Fremont is the county seat and the home of Midland University.
the area saw a great deal of traffic due to the Mormon Trail
column3: which passed along the north bank of the Platte River. A ferry connected the two banks of the Elkhorn River near Fremont. It was a major overland route for emigrant settlers going to the West

column1: Fremont was laid out in 1856 in anticipation that the railroad would be extended to that site. It was named after the American explorer
column2: politician and military official General John C. Frémont.  By 1857
column3: there were 13 log houses in the town. The Union Pacific Railroad reached the town in December 1865 becoming the first railroad into the future rail hub. Sioux City and Pacific Railroad completed track into the town in 1868 with the Elkhorn Valley Railroad arriving in 1869.Due to the town's geographically central location
column5: railroad (1865) and highway (1913) passed through or very near Fremont. Original brick portions of the "Old Lincoln Highway" are located east of Fremont

column1: Fremont is the namesake for the Fremont neighborhood in Seattle
column2: which was settled by Luther H. Griffith and Edward Blewett from Fremont.On January 10
column5: the Pathfinder Hotel exploded due to a natural gas leak in the basement. At the time the hotel was being used as apartments
column6: mostly occupied by senior citizens. It also was a meeting place for philanthropic and business organizations
column7: and had a drug store on the northwest corner. The explosion shattered windows around the city
column8: and the ensuing fire killed 23 people and destroyed most of the city block of the hotel.

column1: Fremont gained national attention in 2010 when residents approved a referendum that would ban illegal immigrants from renting and working in the town.

column1: The Louis E. May Historical Museum is housed in a Victorian house built by Fremont's first mayor
column2: Theron Nye
column3: in 1874. A log cabin on the site is an example of the type of dwelling in which the earliest pioneers lived who moved to Nebraska as part of the Homestead Act. Historic downtown Fremont is known for its numerous antique stores
column4: and a collection of historical buildings.
